entitlements.instructions_project: <0>Entitlements give users and/or reading groups access to this project. In Manifold, all projects are open by default. Enable access restrictions below to limit access to your project.</0><2/><0>ID for CSV entitlement imports:</0></2><1>{{gid}}</1>
entitlements.instructions_journal: <0>Journal entitlements give users and/or reading groups access to all of this journal's issues. You can also configure access to individual issues by granting entitlements on an issue's project.</0><2/><0>ID for CSV entitlement imports:</0></2><1>{{gid}}</1>

new.user_select_placeholder: Select a User or Reading Group
new.expiration_instructions: Enter YYYY/MM/DD or a human-readable string, e.g. 'in one year'

pending.add_instructions: Create an entitlement for a user who has not yet created an account on this Manifold instance. When the user registers, this entitlement will be automatically added to their account.
pending.email_instructions: Email address is used to match newly created accounts to pending entitlements.
pending.type_instructions: Is this entitlement for a project or a journal?
pending.id_instructions: The ID of the project or journal that this is an entitlement to. This ID can be found in the project's url.
pending.expiration_instructions: Optionally, set the expiration date for this entitlement.
pending.upload_instructions: Manifold can import entitlements from a CSV file, including pending entitlements for not yet registered users. See the documentation for CSV format.
pending.name_instructions: Optionally, give the import a name for later reference.
